title: Interior Minister pays glowing tribute to Havaldar Lalak Jan Shaheed
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 07 (APP):Federal Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi has paid rich tribute to Havaldar Lalak Jan Shaheed, the valiant soldier from Gilgit-Baltistan, on the occasion of his martyrdom day. Honoring the recipient of Pakistan’s highest military award, Nishan-e-Haider, Naqvi hailed Lalak Jan as a timeless symbol of patriotism, courage, and sacrifice.
“Lalak Jan Shaheed wrote a glorious chapter in the defense of the homeland with unmatched courage,” Naqvi said in his statement. He emphasized that Lalak Jan’s legendary tale of bravery would remain a source of pride for the nation and a treasured part of Pakistan’s history.
Naqvi highlighted the soldier’s unparalleled resilience, stating that despite being critically wounded during intense enemy shelling, Lalak Jan refused to abandon his post, demonstrating an unwavering spirit that will be remembered for generations.
“This brave son of Pakistan stood like a rock in front of the enemy and became an eternal guardian of the motherland’s borders,” the minister said. “By confronting the enemy head-on from the front lines, he set the highest standard of courage and patriotism.”
He further added that Lalak Jan belongs to the rare class of soldiers whose every step exudes loyalty, valor, and sacrifice. “His unmatched bravery proved that nations win wars through the spirit of their martyrs,” Naqvi remarked.
Calling him a “shining symbol of Pakistan’s military honor, sovereignty, and stability,” Naqvi concluded by saying that Lalak Jan Shaheed is not just a hero of the nation but a living memory in the hearts of the people. “The nation salutes his unmatched gallantry and sacrifice.”
